availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Native of Kentucky. Worked as a lawyer in Louisville. Selby T. Harney received an officer's commission in Company S of the Kentucky Guard Infantry in March 1862. Harney became an officer in the thirty-fourth Kentucky volunteer infantry in October 1862. Harney was promoted to Lt. Colonel in February 1863 and received the rank of full colonel in June 1863. Harney mustered out of the armed forces in December 1863.
Children: Selby Harney, John H Harney, Elizabeth Harney, Reuben Harney

bibl.p: U.S. Civil War Pension Index, General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, Harmer to Harrington, certificate no. 395.808.

U.S. Soldiers Civil War Records and Profiles, 1861-1865, Selby T. Harney, http://search.ancestry.com/cgi-bin/sse.dll?indiv=1&db=civilwarhistdatasys&h=725409&tid=&pid=&usePUB=true&phsrc=LiK3033&_phstart=successSource&usePUBJs=true&rhSource=7163 accessed 03/14/2017.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Two Mile House Precinct, page 32.
U.S. Find a Grave Index, 1600-Present, Selby T Harney, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=81660388 accessed 03/14/2017.
